metadata.Title: CVE-2019-1010301 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: jhead 3.03 is affected by: Buffer Overflow. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gpsinfo.c Line 151 ProcessGpsInfo(). The attack vector is: Open a specially crafted JPEG file. It was discovered that jhead did not properly handle certain crafted input. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious JPEG file, a remote attacker could cause jhead to crash.

criterions.comment: jhead: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
